place.name: LAWRENNI
place.gazetteerText: LAWRENNY, a parish in the district and county of Pembroke: on Milford haven, 4 miles NNE of Pembroke r. station. It has a post office under Pembroke. Acres, 2, 672; of which 310 are water. Real property, £1, 692. Pop., 339. Houses, 74. The property belongs to G. Lort Phillips, Esq; and Lawrenny Hall, a very fine mansion, is Mr. Phillips' seat. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £168. Patron, George Lort Phillips, Esq. The church is good; and there are charities £50. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
